instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R6905: What is R6905? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on older Macbooks, pre-2011 models. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..
definitions.C6990: What is C6990? Capacitor to ground on input to PP3V42_G3H power supply. PP3V42_G3H power supply turns 18.5v from charger or 8.5v-12.5v PPBUS_G3H from the battery into PP3V42_G3H. This capacitor can short to ground and keep PP3V42_G3H from turning on which would keep the machine from having a light on the magsafe charger.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Board is water damage, at first no green light no nothing.
<CHIP>U6990</CHIP> was damage, <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR>, and small resistor in the area with some degree of damage or oxidation, change all.

Now I have <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and green light.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> working fine.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> don't let pass <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
I have 17.56V in pin 1, 2 and 3
and 15.6V in Pin 4 
Only 3.7V on Pin 5, with a very little pulse about 0.04V

I have already change <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, values for <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> are normal.

What else should I check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
First check resistance to ground at L7030.
Post some voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>; pins 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 19, 20.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
L7030 resistance to ground is 454

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>:
Pin 2: 18.31V
Pin 3: 4.35V
Pin 9: 0.04V
Pin 12: 3.35V
Pin 13: 3.35V
Pin 14: 3.14V
Pin 15: 0.07V
Pin 19: 5.08V
Pin 20: 5.08V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Post exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Also post resistance value (measured onboard, ohm scale) for <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86.
Did you change <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Pins 17/18, resistance is 2.9
Pins 27/28 resistance is 20.2
<RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> is 316 Kohms
<RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> is 468 Kohms
From pin 1 in <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> to Pin 4 in <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> resistance is 801 Kohms
<RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> is 99.3 Kohms
<RESISTOR>R7081</RESISTOR> is 62.5 Kohms

I have continuity from pin 26 in <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R7081</RESISTOR>

Yes, I have already replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Resistance to ground at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?
Voltage <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, pins 1 y 26?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Resistencia en <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> to ground = 611

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 1 = 15.81V
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 26= 16.78V

And I'm using a power supply set at 17.8V (that knob is is a hard to set, so I set it between 17V up to 18.5V)

Hablas espa?ol?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
It should work with bench power supply and 60/85W cable.
But you MUST have an original 85W charger on the service; both styles, Magsafe 1 and 2.

Check all traces and surrounding components for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Solder another <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, if don't find other things bad; do NOT use <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>.

Mejor hablar ingles en el foro.
Asi toda la gente nos puede seguir mas facil...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> (I use a <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> from store.rossmanngroup.com) and <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> (from donor board) again, same result.
I took out <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>, and between <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> is 0.1 V and between <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is 1.3V.

So <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> is clearly not opening, 
Check all resistance around U700 all are good. traces look fine.

I use a 85W original cable in my power supply for both Magsafe 1 and 2, but only have a Magsafe 1 85W original charger.

I will remove <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> and inject voltage to <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> and see if I get to open it.

S?lo preguntaba porque pusiste un "y" en vez de "and", y me dio curiosidad, pero entiendo es solo en ingl?s.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
The current will always flow through <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>.
No matters <SIGNAL>CHGR_SGATE</SIGNAL> level, internal diode is there.

Do NOT inject voltage; <SIGNAL>CHGR_AGATE</SIGNAL> should be pulled down.
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> probably detects some issue and keeps <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> blocked.
Did you test <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> out of the board, before solder it?

Post ALL voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>; a ver si suena la flauta.
Keep F7040 removed, until input stage problem is solved.

"pusiste un "y" en vez de "and""
Bueno, aveces me equivoco; el ingles is not my native idioma.
Tampoco el spanish, ya que soy from Romania ;)
